response: narrative=Lewis Birch, a retired secondary school teacher with a disability, was last seen at his home on Hall Road, Rhu. His sister, Marian Birch, had spoken with him over the phone earlier that day, noting that he sounded unusually agitated. Concerned for his well-being, she intended to visit him. However, upon her arrival, Lewis was nowhere to be found. His absence prompted immediate concern given his high initial risk level. Extensive searches were conducted in the surrounding areas, but it was in a confused state that Lewis was eventually traced and found on Fulton Road by the police. His disappearance was determined to be non-criminal, attributed to disorientation linked to his condition.

narrative=Lewis Birch, who had recently been released from prison, was last seen at a resort on Acre Drive, Glasgow, G20 0TR. Despite being in the company of his sister, Marian Birch, Lewis decided to venture out on his own to nearby attractions. Witnesses later reported seeing him at a petting zoo on Main Road, G84 0AH, where he interacted animatedly with visitors and animals alike. Concerns arose when his daughter, Beverley Douglas, grew worried due to his history of wandering and difficulty managing in unfamiliar environments. After receiving no word from him for several hours, family members alerted the authorities. Police traced him to 6 Bard Avenue, Glasgow, G13 3JA, concluding the search after a tense 48-hour period, reassuring family and friends who had anxiously awaited news on Lewis's whereabouts.

narrative=Lewis Birch, a 68-year-old male, was reported missing when he failed to return home on Hall Road, Rhu after a regular walking route visit with his daughter to the petting zoo at 112-117 West Clyde Street, Helensburgh. Concerned after not receiving his usual check-in call, Lewis's daughter went to his residence but found it empty. It was later discovered that Lewis had intended to visit a nearby resort. Instead, he took an unintended route, becoming disoriented in the process. After being missing for several hours, a member of the public found Lewis wandering near Fulton Road, G62 8PG. He was safely returned to his family in reasonable health and spirits.

narrative=Lewis Birch, recently released from prison, was reported missing from his home at Hall Road, Rhu. Lewis, who had been living a quiet life since his release, was reportedly seen leaving 112-117 West Clyde Street, Helensburgh, G84 8ES, but failed to return home as expected. Given his low-risk status and the relatively short duration of his disappearance, initial efforts focused on checking locations familiar to him, including his frequent visits to the West Clyde Street area. It was determined that Lewis had taken an impromptu trip to sort out personal matters, unaware of the concern his absence had caused his family.

narrative=Lewis Birch, a former teacher, was reported missing from his home on Hall Road, Rhu. Close to his home, he was last seen by a neighbor heading in the direction of Main Road, G84 0AH. The police eventually found him on Acre Drive, Glasgow, G20 0TR, having traveled much further than he typically did, leading to his eventual rescue and safe return.

narrative=Lewis Birch, a 71-year-old retiree, was reported missing after failing to return from a visit to an animal petting zoo located near Acre Drive, Glasgow. Having spent a tranquil afternoon there with his sister, Marian Birch, Lewis had mentioned wanting to take a leisurely walk to the resort nearby. He was known to enjoy such outings, yet concerns arose when he did not respond to his sister's calls. Given Lewis's history of occasional disorientation, Marian contacted the authorities. Police initiated a search, eventually tracing Lewis to Crow Road, Glasgow. He was found disoriented but unharmed, an indication that he had lost his way during his walk. Despite the distress caused, Lewis was reunited with his sister and returned safely home.
